column5: Hi!!!! New to this board. I grew up fishing in Southern and Central Ontario and moved 3 years ago to the NWT because I got tired of the congestion in Southern Ontario. My favorite species are trout and salmon but won't turn up my nose at 40"+ pike I spent most of my time growing up chasing steelhead, but now I chase Lakers mostly. I still chase bows on my yearly vacations to Alaska.
Welcome, sounds like your in the right place, gotta like that Laker...
Hmmm....you look vaguely familiar.....LOL!  Welcome bud, this is a nice surprise.
Welcome to the board and that Laker looks like a brute.
Welcome aboard! That laker is ridiculas!
welcome aboard  is that laker for real !!  Looking forward to more pictures ,,,we love pictures
Welcome Drifter and what a way to introduce yourself. Is that a Great Slave monster?  Cheers, 1leg
Welcome to OFC DRIFTER_016  How much does that laker weigh??   Enormous Leechman
Actually it is a Great Bear Lake Laker and it's not all that big, the photo angle does do it justice though. It's in the low to mid 40# range. Here's a brute for ya!!  61# Great Bear Laker
Welcome aboard,  recognise you from FF.net
Welcome Drifter, nice fish! Thought I recognized your pic!
Good to see you joined .... Always enjoyed your posts on FF.net ... Your going to have quite a fan club on this site with your fish and landscape !!!!
Thanks DRIFTER..... Look at that MONSTER     Unreal....
welcome aboard  oh, those leviathan NWT lakers are welcome as well, lol. Really nice catch, wow.
Geez, from solo's awesome post to this, I am full of jealousy  Welcome aboard!!!!!!!!!!!
Welcome to the board Dave, sounds like reading up awesome reports will be taking a bit longer time on the computer with likes of Mike, Drew, and yourself adding to the other great guys and gals here.
